messages.subject: a local homeschooler goes to school
messages.msgSnippet: These are quotes from a girl here who has been homeschooled (pretty much unschooled except for self-imposed projects) for five or six years, but who decided to
messages.messageBody:
These are quotes from a girl here who has been homeschooled (pretty much
unschooled except for self-imposed projects) for five or six years, but who
decided to go to 10th grade. They didn't tell the school she's technically
only the age of a 9th grader. Here, though, are the quotes her mom remembers
from the first day:



Biology is too much like school.

Too much like an all day Girl Scout event

Drama is great

I have to take humanities ALL year??

Iâ€™m tired

I'm either playing video games or going online (this was said in a psuedo
just dare to stop me voice while smiling)

Just barely sat down to eat when the bell rang to go back to class

It'll probably be a couple of days before I realize how much time I'm wasting.


I love seeing kids' "first impressions" of school (even though Kendra went
when she was little, she hasn't been for a long time, and high school without
midschool would be an all-of-a-sudden newness.

I love the time-wasting one.

Sandra
